perhaps.translation[0].definitions[0].de: used to say that something may be true, but you are not sure
perhaps.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: It won’t take so long next time, perhaps.
‘I don’t think you understand.’ ‘Well, perhaps not.’
perhaps.translation[0].definitions[0].no: In everyday English, people usually use may or might rather than use perhaps it/she/they etc will:
perhaps.translation[0].definitions[1].de: used to give your opinion, when you do not want to be too definite
perhaps.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: This is perhaps her finest novel yet.
The industrial revolution was, perhaps, the most important event in history.
perhaps.translation[0].definitions[2].de: used to say that a number is only a guess
perhaps.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The room was large, perhaps 20 feet square.
perhaps.translation[0].definitions[3].de: used to politely ask or suggest something, or say what you are going to do
perhaps.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: I thought perhaps we’d have lunch in the garden.
